001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.annotation;
002
003import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.CLASS;
004
005import java.lang.annotation.Documented;
006import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
007import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
008import java.lang.annotation.Target;
009
010// @formatter:off
011/**
012 * Used to generate Rainbow Gum config builder objects that once built will call the
013 * method annotated with the properties from the generated builder on build. The method
014 * annotated is essentially a factory method that a builder will be generated to configure
015 * each parameter in the factory method. The build call on the builder will call the
016 * annotated factory method.
017 * <p>
018 * While there exist many annotation processors that generate builders (Immutables for
019 * example) the builders generated by this annotation (and corresponding processor) are
020 * LogProperties aware such that the builder can extract its arguments from LogProperties.
021 * <p>
022 * Here is an example:
023 * {@snippet :
024class final SomeFactory {
025        @LogConfigurable(name="MyPluginBuilder", prefix="logging.myplugin.{name}.")
026        static MyPlugin of(@KeyParameter String name, Integer myParameter) {
027                // do some additional logic.
028                return new MyPlugin(name, myParameter);
029        }
030 }
031 * }
032 * The above will create a builder called <code>MyPluginBuilder</code> with a setter of
033 * <code>myParameter</code> and its constructor will take a String name argument.
034 * {@snippet :
035 * MyPlugin plugin = new MyPluginBuilder("example").myParameter(80).fromProperties(properties).build();
036 * }
037 * The builder will try the property <code>logging.myplugin.example.myParameter</code> and
038 * use it if it exists to override the <code>80</code> value.
039 */
040// @formatter:on
041@Retention(CLASS)
042@Target({ ElementType.CONSTRUCTOR, ElementType.METHOD })
043@Documented
044public @interface LogConfigurable {
045
046        /**
047         * Name of builder.
048         * @return name of builder by default if not set Builder will be suffixed to
049         * targetType.
050         */
051        String name() default "";
052
053        /**
054         * Property prefix to use for property lookup. Usually these come from LogProperties
055         * string constants and have a parameter of "name". If the prefix has parameters they
056         * can be specified with {@link KeyParameter} as arguments on the static factory
057         * method.
058         * <p>
059         * An example might be: "logging.component.{name}." which has a parameter of "name".
060         * @return prefix in general should end in ".".
061         * @see KeyParameter
062         */
063        String prefix();
064
065        /**
066         * Use as parameter to property keys with parameters. This annotation should only be
067         * used on String arguments and the builder will require it as an initial constructor
068         * argument to avoid it being missing.
069         */
070        @Retention(CLASS)
071        @Target({ ElementType.PARAMETER })
072        @Documented
073        public @interface KeyParameter {
074
075                /**
076                 * Use as parameter to a property name specified in
077                 * {@link LogConfigurable#prefix()}. An example is a parameter called
078                 * <code>name</code> with a prefix like <code>logging.myplugin.{name}.</code>
079                 * @return by default will use the parameter name.
080                 */
081                String value() default "";
082
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Use to set static defaults to parameters.
087         */
088        @Retention(CLASS)
089        @Target({ ElementType.PARAMETER })
090        @Documented
091        public @interface DefaultParameter {
092
093                /**
094                 * Will use use a static field on the factory class (the class that contains the
095                 * annotated {@link LogConfigurable} method) as a default value if missing from
096                 * properties or not set.
097                 * @return by default will use the static field
098                 * <code>DEFAULT_parameterName</code>.
099                 */
100                String value() default "";
101
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Wall call a static method on the factory class (the class that contains the
106         * annotated {@link LogConfigurable} method) with the property value as a string to be
107         * converted.
108         */
109        @Retention(CLASS)
110        @Target({ ElementType.PARAMETER })
111        @Documented
112        public @interface ConvertParameter {
113
114                /**
115                 * Static method on target type to call to convert the parameter. The method must
116                 * be return a type and have a single argument.
117                 * @return static method name.
118                 */
119                String value();
120
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * A parameter not to be configured with properties that will just pass through to the
125         * build method.
126         */
127        @Retention(CLASS)
128        @Target({ ElementType.PARAMETER })
129        @Documented
130        public @interface PassThroughParameter {
131
132        }
133
134}
